About Me

Hi, I am Siming He

I am a junior studying Computer and Information Science, Statistics, and Mathematics at the Engineering School and the Wharton School of University of Pennsylvania. My research interest is in the field of robotics and machine learning. I am currently a student researcher mentored by Pratik Chaudhari in the GRASP Robotics Laboratory. I’m also working on projects in Vijay Kumar Lab.

I am originally from Xi’an, a city with long history, in north-central China. I stayed in Canada for three years during high school.

I love swimming and am national second-level athlete in China. I also play tennis and soccer, and I was in my high school soccer and tennis varsity teams. Beside sports, I enjoy cooking, especially Sichuan and Shaanxi Cuisine. I also like reading random books during my free time.

You can find my resume here.
